summary: This document is a trial preparation memo from an Assistant U.S. Attorney (AUSA) detailing clarifications and preparations for an upcoming trial. It focuses on a witness's review of CDs seized from Jeffrey Epstein's New York residence, the understanding of file metadata, and the identification of trial exhibits (GX items) related to locations, victims, and targets.

persons.name: AUSA Del
persons.context: Author of the trial preparation memo, coordinating witness preparation and evidence review for an upcoming trial.

connections.description: Working together on trial preparation, specifically regarding the review of evidence (CDs) seized from Epstein's residence.
GM is identified as a target in the investigation, with evidence from JE's residence being reviewed for connections to GM.

events.title: CD Review Completion
events.description: A witness and an FBI Special Agent (SA) completed a review of CDs seized from Jeffrey Epstein's New York residence.

events.title: Trial Preparation Memo
events.description: An AUSA prepared a memo detailing clarifications and evidence preparations for an upcoming trial related to the Epstein case.

keyFacts: CDs containing images were seized from Jeffrey Epstein's New York residence and reviewed as evidence.
A witness clarified that the CD review with an FBI Special Agent was completed in summer 2020, not 2019.
The witness understands that 'created date' in file metadata reflects when a file was copied to an FBI computer, while 'modified date' reflects when the image file was originally created.
Photos from the seized CDs were reviewed to identify images of relevant locations, victims, or targets, including an individual referred to as 'GM'.
A chart was created linking specific trial exhibit numbers (GX-304, etc.) to their corresponding 1B numbers and CD titles for trial presentation.
